item.title: Report X-2024101511
item.description:
Report X-2024101511

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LOADER FOUND LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE ON THE CONVEYOR BELT. LOADER NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR AND SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP. RMP SENDED RESPONDER TO BAY 520 AND RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH SPILL CART, DECISION TREE, AND PPE ON. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE AND SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE AND CLEANED UP ANY REMAINING RESIDUE.

item.title: Report X-2024101493
item.description:
Report X-2024101493

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DURING PACKAGE REWRAP. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A 9.1 OUNCE AEROSOL CAN OF FLAMMABLE AVEDA AIR CONTROL LIGHT HOLD HAIRSPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE AN AEROSOL PRODUCT WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. SHIPPER APPLIED STICKER ON THE BOX INDICATES HAZ:X. THERE IS ALSO ONE BOTTLE OF AVEDA VOLUMIZING TONIC AT 3.4 OZ THAT APPEARS TO MEET 173.150(G) ETHYL ALCOHOL EXCEPTION IN TRANSPORTATION.

item.title: Report E-2024100526
item.description:
Report E-2024100526

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-23T09:14:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 2, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of methanol was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services. LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew was unable to identify any released product and concluded that any released methanol had evaporated prior to arrival. EWI Personnel utilized chemical tape to patch the hole in the drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum was placed into one (1) 85-gallon overpack and was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024101222
item.description:
Report X-2024101222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-12
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS PREVIOUSLY FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM EWR TO RFD. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE X 32 OZ BOTTLE OF CORROSIVE CBC PLUS TOILET BOWL CLEANER (UN1805, PHOSPHORIC ACID SOLUTION, PG III) LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. ALSO LEAKING BUT SDS OBTAINED DOES NOT SPECIFY AIR TRANSPORTATION IS ONE X 32 OZ BOTTLE OF RAPID MULTI SURFACE DISINFECTANT CLEANER. ADDITIONAL DANGEROUS GOODS IN THE PACKAGE THAT DID NOT LEAK ARE TWO FLAMMABLE AEROSOL PRODUCTS. (1) 20 OZ AEROSOL CAN OF FLAMMABLE KEYSTONE SATIN SHINE STAINLESS STEEL CLEANER (UN1950, AEROSOLS, 2.1) AND (1) 17 OZ AEROSOL CAN OF FLAMMABLE KEYSTONE FURNITURE POLISH (UN1950, AEROSOLS, 2.1). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024101232

  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. The package appears to have been punctured on the bottom, leaking apprx 0.5 liters inside the van. The plasitc drum UN1H1Y1.8/100/24 USA/+AA0544 was placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024100421
item.description:
Report E-2024100421

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 7, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3098 was punctured in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the site. EWI personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3098-impacted trailer floor. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon overpack and all impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.
